info.name: Oracle Fusion Cloud CX Sales - Sales Forecast Metric Source Items
info.description:
REST API collection for Oracle Fusion Cloud Sales and Service â€” Sales Forecast Metric Source Items module.

Created by [Adrian Anderson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aanderson1017/) | [YouTube - Better Human Applications](https://www.youtube.com/@BetterHumanApplications)

item.name: Sales Forecast Metric Source Items
Get a sales forecast metric source item

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

variable.description:
(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- MetricSrcPk1, MetricSrcPk2 and MetricSrcPk3 ---for the Sales Forecast Metric Source Items resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Sales Forecast Metric Source Items. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Sales Forecast Metric Source Items collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Sales Forecast Metric Source Items.

For example: salesForecastMetricSourceItems?q=MetricSrcPk1=<value1>;MetricSrcPk2=<value2>;MetricSrcPk3=<value3>

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

item.name: Get all sales forecast metric source items

header.description: The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

query.description: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • BadgeAttribute; string; The primary changed attribute name that's displayed on the badge of the Opportunity card.
  • BadgeStatus; string; The direction of change in the primary changed attribute.
  • ChangedAttributes; string; The list of all attributes that were changed after the selected date.
  • ChangesSince; string; The date after which the change in opportunities have to be displayed.
  • DiagnosticQuery; string; The parameter for gathering internal diagnostics for sales forecast metric source items. The default value is null.
  • Dim1Code; string; The dimension code of the first registered dimension.
  • Dim1Name; string; The dimension name of the first registered dimension.
  • Dim1ParentKey; integer; The dimension key of the first registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim1ParentName; string; The dimension name of the first registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim2Code; string; The dimension code of the second registered dimension.
  • Dim2Name; string; The dimension name of the second registered dimension.
  • Dim2ParentKey; integer; The dimension key of the second registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim2ParentName; string; The dimension name of the second registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim2RootFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the sales forecast metric source item is the root value of the second registered dimension. The values accepted are true or false.
  • Dim3Code; string; The dimension code of the third registered dimension.
  • Dim3Name; string; The dimension name of the third registered dimension.
  • Dim3ParentKey; integer; The dimension key of the third registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim3ParentName; string; The dimension name of the third registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim3RootFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the sales forecast metric source item is the root value of the third registered dimension. The values accepted are true or false.
  • Dim4Code; string; The dimension code of the fourth registered dimension.
  • Dim4Name; string; The dimension name of the fourth registered dimension.
  • Dim4ParentKey; integer; The dimension key of the fourth registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim4ParentName; string; The dimension name of the fourth registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim4RootFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the sales forecast metric source item is the root value of the fourth registered dimension. The values accepted are true or false.
  • Dim5Code; string; The dimension code of the fifth registered dimension.
  • Dim5Name; string; The dimension name of the fifth registered dimension.
  • Dim5ParentKey; integer; The dimension key of the fifth registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim5ParentName; string; The dimension name of the fifth registered dimension for the parent.
  • Dim5RootFlag; boolean; Indicates whether the sales forecast metric source item is the root value of the fifth registered dimension. The values accepted are true or false.
  • IsAdjusted; integer; Indicates whether the sales forecast metric source item is adjusted. The values accepted are true or false.
  • MetricCode; string; The name of the sales forecast metric.
  • MetricLevel; string; The level of the adjustment of the sales forecast metric source item. Values include TOTAL representing the adjustments made by the current user and-SUB representing adjustments made by subordinates.
  • MetricSourceExtensionReference; string; A JSON string with the list of extensible attributes and their values to be shown on the opportunity card.
  • MetricSourceGrain; string; The metric source grain of the sales forecast metric source items which identifies whether summary or detail level information is provided. By default summary level information is provided. If the metric source grain value is DETAIL then detail level information is provided.
  • MetricSourceReference; string; The current state of opportunity attributes to be compared with the snapshot state.
  • MetricSourceSnapshotReference; string; The state of opportunity attributes taken from the snapshot.
  • MetricSrcCode; string; The metric source code for the source item.
  • MetricSrcPk1; integer; The first unique identifier of the sales forecast metric source item.
  • MetricSrcPk2; integer; The second unique identifier of the sales forecast metric source item.
  • MetricSrcPk3; integer; The third unique identifier of the sales forecast metric source item.
  • PeriodId; integer; The unique identifier of the forecast metric source item period.
  • RootParticipantId; integer; The unique identifier of the forecast metric source item root participant.
  • SrcItemAccount; string; The account for the forecast metric source item.
  • SrcItemCloseDate; string; The close date for the forecast metric source item.
  • SrcItemMetricValue; number; The item metric value for the source item.
  • SrcItemName; string; The item metric name for the source item.
  • SrcItemNumber; string; The item metric number for the source item.
  • SrcItemOwnerName; string; The owner name for the forecast metric source item.
  • SrcMetricCode; string; The item metric code for the source item.
  • UnadjItemMetricValue; number; The sales forecast metric source item value prior to adjustments such as the value of the opportunity.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the sales forecast metric source item by primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • MetricSrcPk1; integer; The first unique identifier of the metric source used to search a sales forecast metric source item.
    • MetricSrcPk2; integer; The second unique identifier of the metric source used to search a sales forecast metric source item.
    • MetricSrcPk3; integer; The third unique identifier of the metric source used to search a sales forecast metric source item.

item.description: The sales forecast metric source items resource is used to view the information for the metric sources that are directly or indirectly owned by a particular forecast participant.
